description: CRITICAL: Domain concepts must hide calculation timing. Properties hide when calculations occurâ€”they may be computed on-demand, cached, pre-computed, or loaded from storage. The caller shouldn't know or care when the value was calculated.

do.description: Use properties that hide calculation timing
content: Responsibilities should use 'Get X' not 'Calculate X'
Properties hide when calculations occur (on-demand, cached, pre-computed)
Callers shouldn't know when value was calculated
Correct Examples (timing hidden):
Portfolio
Get total value: Holdings (could be calculated now, cached, or pre-computed)
Get risk score: Holdings, RiskModel (computation timing hidden)
Get performance metrics: Holdings, PerformanceCalculator

dont.description: Don't expose calculation timing in responsibilities
content: Don't use 'Calculate X' (reveals it's calculated NOW)
Don't use 'Get cached X' (reveals it's cached)
Don't reveal when or how calculations happen
Wrong Examples (timing exposed):
Portfolio
Calculate total value: Holdings (reveals it's calculated NOW)
Get cached total value: None (reveals it's cached)
Compute risk score: Holdings, RiskModel (reveals computation)
Timing Exposure Indicators (REJECT):
- Responsibilities starting with 'Calculate', 'Compute', 'Derive'
- Responsibilities mentioning 'cached', 'pre-computed', 'on-demand'
- Responsibilities that reveal implementation timing
